intro: Eleocharis melanocarpa, commonly known as blackroot sedge, is a flowering plant species native to wetland environments in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant features triangular, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in shallow, nutrient-rich waters and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Eleocharis melanocarpa plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
